Reviews.Title: “A great deal!”
Reviews.Author: lifeofangels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Lesseps about 30 minutes walk to las Ramblas, but very close to the L4 subway station so it was only a quick trip to get to Placa Catalunya and Friday the metro runs til 1am and Saturdays the subway runs 24 hours. We took the airport bus (about 5.10 euro) from the airport to Placa Catalunya and then caught the subway to the hotel. We walked up by the giant library in the Lesseps square to our hotel. There is also a supermarket across the way! The hotel is nice. You can hear people from upstairs rooms but we slept great. We got a triple occ. and the 2 beds were full beds and one twin. All were comfortable. Some street noise from the cars passing below but its a really quiet residential neighborhood. Our bathroom was clean and we had hot water all of the time! Not too shabby with 3 girls! Room was a decent size and we had a safe and hair dryer but only 3 clothes hangers. There is also an ironing board but no iron. Lots of outlets. The wi-fi isn't free but it reaches to the second floor. No mini fridge but we turned our window into one. (Hey we went in Jan/Feb it was super cold outside so we kept our water and snacks out there. lol) Reception was nice and helpful. They spoke English! :) You'll see most people in BCN don't! So brush up on some phrases in Spanish! There is breakfast for extra $$ but we never tried it. There is a soda machine and water machine too. (I'd recommend going to the super market and having water on hand no matter what time of year you go) The hotel is next to Park Guell so you can leave that for your last day if you want to relax and walk around the neighborhood. There is also a bakery by the library and a shop with lots of tourist stuff for cheap further down. For 3 girls in Jan/Feb we loved the place and we'd def stay again! Remember you get what ou pay for. A warm, clean place to sleep. If you want luxury then suck it up and pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “barcelona short visit”
Reviews.Author: chillax_A
Reviews.Content: visited for 4 days. weren't enough to enjoy the city to its maximum. LOVELY destination to get to. has everything you could wish for. Hotel was average. rooms seemed a bit decadent and not redecorated for a while. requested double bed but was allocated to 2 singles. Price was very affordable. Receptionists were very helpful. Cleanliness up to standard. only problem were the dark corridors! felt like i was in a morgue! otherwise it was very good location. close to metro station and hop on hop off bus. barcelona made it worth it tho!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel of my life...”
Reviews.Author: snowbunny783
Reviews.Content: "Hotel" Ronda was absolutely disgusting. It might as well be called HOSTEL RONDA. I booked it through the internet and unfortunately when I arrived it was nothing like it was advertised. The parking below was a joke, the staff I spoke to which was ABEGAIL PAPIO and DEICHEL ADAJAN were extremely unfriendly and unhelpful. I walked into my room and literally left 5 minutes after. I told the staff I couldn't stay here as the hotel was nothing like it was advertised, the rooms were dirty and it was extremely loud. Even though I had only been there for 5 minutes the staff refused to refund my 2 nights stay and also refused to refund my 2 day parking. I asked for the manager and they said he would was not there and wouldn't come to the hotel to speak to me. I'm not worried of course as I paid with American Express and the "Hotel" Ronda won't be getting a Euro. I strongly suggest that anyone who wishes to stay in Barcelona should stay somewhere else. We chose The Pullman which was amazing!! Good luck!!

Reviews.Title: “price is a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: borsh
Reviews.Content: It's a quiet little hotel located far from downtown, but close enough to the Park Guell. There is parking, next to a supermarket, a subway station. The room is not very big. Wi-fi is not free and works only on the first floor. Price is clearly overstated, but it's OK for Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: LittleCurrant
Reviews.Content: This hotel was slightly out of the main centre, but very close to a subway station so it was only a quick trip on the subway to get into the centre of town (on Saturdays the subway runs 24 hours). We took the airport bus (about 5 euro) from the airport to the central Plaza and then caught the subway to the hotel. Took about 30minutes for the entire trip. We didn't have a great map, but even so, finding the hotel from the subway took about 10 minutes. The hotel itself was pleasant. Some street noise (but nothing that earplugs didn't fix). The bathroom was clean and we had hot water all of the time. Room was a decent size and we had a safe and hair dryer. No fridge. Didn't find the counter staff to be especially helpful, but the locals were more than willing to point us in the right direction. This hotel is also near one of the stops for the Turista bus (red line/ blue line) which was very handy. A lovely restaurant down the road and lots of bakeries and coffee shops dotted around. There are 2 mini-supermarkets 1minute down the road from the hotel. All in all this was a perfectly acceptable hotel and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Definitive Choice”
Reviews.Author: ChongSS
Reviews.Content: Located in a very quite neighbourhood. Not that far from the metro station, hence moving around is not a problem. Counter service is excellent. Special mention of Mr. Marco Belviz, very friendly, helpful and gives appropriate advices at all times. Hotel services can further be improved on: 1. equip the room with kettle 2. thermostat control on air-con 3. wash room cleanliness. In conclusion, a good choice for travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality”
Reviews.Author: rb2008Liverpool
Reviews.Content: Close to Metro, Clean Rooms : Cleaned daily, fresh towels, Some English TV stations. Room walls a little thin can hear next doors tv. Staff friendly easy check in and check out. Could use thicked bedding as rooms can get really cold during the night time but overall a good clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, this hotel misses the mark.”
Reviews.Author: VegasFellow
Reviews.Content: This hotel could be nice but misses the mark. I am not sure why there are so many good reviews. If the beds were comfortable we may have given it a better review but they are like boxsprings with a blanket thrown on them. At least 1 English station (even CNN) would make this nicer for Americans. The room was clean except for the filthy shower. Even worse, no AC after October so we had to go to a local store 2 mins away and pay 25 euros for a fan. Sorry, we can't recommend this no-frills hotel. They rate it 3 stars but we barely give it 2. PROS- Great front desk staff - Very helpful. In room safe. Morning breakfast bar was good, cheap and convenient. Only 2 blocks to Lesseps subway station. Neighborhood appeared safe. Good restaurants within 10 min walk. CONS- 1. Noisy area - construction across street, busy traffic on front and side streets, could hear walking in above room till 3AM every night, could hear water running down pipes from above rooms. 2. No english TV stations. 3. Very hard beds. Double bed was just two singles pushed together. 4. No air conditioning. Clerk explained that AC is turned off in entire hotel in October so only heat. Temps were in 70s so had to keep window open and listen to constant traffic including mopeds and buses. Thermostat in room does nothing as heat controlled by computer at front desk. 5. MILDEW ridden bathroom. Other than this bathroom was cleaned everyday. They need to learn what bleach is. 6. Expensive internet - 3 euros an hour. 7. Had to go to front desk to get TV remote first day.

Reviews.Title: “Close to metro, but little amenities in neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: bsballbabe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is off the beaten track, but very close to the metro which was great (4 stops from Las Ramblas). There are very few open restaurants in the neighborhood so if you come back to the hotel you would need to hop back on the metro for food and nightlife. It is a nice respite from the hustle of Barcelona. The rooms are more than adequate and very clean. The staff was friendly, helpful and accommodating. There are concrete floors in the hallways so noises echo. There is a charge for Wi-Fi and the breakfast is a bit on the high side (8 euros) for the quality. There is a bar in the hotel, but it never appeared to be open.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: 5n0wb04rdEver
Reviews.Content: Location: Good location, close to the Lessep metro station. From the metro (line 3) it is easy to get to all the sights you want to visit as a tourist. The hotel is also very close to Park Gûell, I can recommend a visit there. Several supermarkets close to the hotel (50-100m). ATM 50m from the hotel. About the hotel: Friendly staff, clean rooms, air-condition and quite at night. They have WiFi but it is not free. You get great value your money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: wilkoe
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. Friendly staff, clean rooms, quiet, working air conditioning, near Parc Guell.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price I paid”
Reviews.Author: Calo21
Reviews.Content: Normally, I like to stay in hotelswhich are located in the center of everything, where all the action is. When I saw this hotel in the Internet, the price was half the cost of what other hotels in Ramblas cost. As I was on a budget and knowing that the hotel was located 3-5 minutes from a metro station, I decided to take a chance. My experience has been very positive. Service from all the 3 reception managers was outstanding, clean and modern rooms, ample bathrooms and the neighborhood is nice with casual and simple cafes, bars and restaurants. It is not located in the center of everything, but who cares as long you have a metro station which can take you anywhere, especially if it is only 4 metro stops from Ramblas (15 minute ride). Actually, it would be safer to stay away from Ramblas which can be dangerous at night after 11pm. Also dont expect great exterior visuals from your room windows. This is the only setback. All the rest, is great. I would definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona's Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Leopetruska
Reviews.Content: A great surprise, the room is good and the bath is new and clean. The bath include a jacuzzi and hair dryer.The room has a great space including a desk. It's near a metro station and it's in a quiet neighboorhood. The hotel is renovated and the people is friendly in all services. The rates are very good.The location is near Pq. Gaudi, but the other attraction are 3 or 4 station. The problem for a couple is the bed, because there's no double or queen bed, they make a double bed with two twin beds. The air conditioner has a temperature control but work just to cold or hot, you can really control it. There's a fast internet for a small charge and the breakfest cost 8 Euro each. I recommend it for people looking for a good hotel spend not much money with a reasonable confort. There's a great commerce near but not much things working 24h.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: jgpe
Reviews.Content: we got delayed 2 more nights due to the snow in the uk! this was the cheapest hotel we could find and the pictures looked fine. when arrived we walked around to find it looked a bit of a rough area but it wasnt actually that bad once we been out during the day. its like 5 mins from a metro station. loads of supermarkets & cafes. the rooms where really big! the bed was really uncompy. the bathroom was also big with a whirl pool bath tub that didnt actually work. you had to pay extra for eveything you used plus no fridges in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all cost”
Reviews.Author: ruizvicentello
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because they had the lowest priced double room in Barcelona, and Wi-Fi in the rooms (at 8 Euros per day). It is located in a slightly rough neighborhood, a bit far away from the action, however a Metro station is 2 blocks away. Our bad experience begun immediatly: they charged the full 4 days of our stay the day we arrived; also the Wi-Fi was down all the time. I got room 203. The window lock was broken, and was so smelly, that we requested a change. The gave us room 103, wich was appearently OK until we discovered that night the pillows smelled to human sweat; and worst of all, the drainage piping croses thru that room, so we heard a loud water (and whatever came with it) roaring noise in the room every time a toiled was flushed upstairs. It was really disgusting - the noise was so clear and loud that seemed like the waste waters were spilled in our floor. Every night we had to leave the TV on trying to block the sewage noise and get some sleep. The 4th night was the worst. The water noise stayed for hours - we suspected a toilet was leaking and had the hotel people check our room at 3:00 AM. They said it was "the air conditioning". We had to catch an early flight but we did not get much sleep because of the noise. We tried to leave the hotel during the second day, but they refused to refund my money - I treatened to call the Consumer Affairs at Barcelona but they didn't seem to care. I've been a international traveler for 31 years, and I think this is the worst experience I've had in a hotel. Please do not ruin your trip to this beautiful city by staying at this place.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and not very cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Carno
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ronda Lesseps is a long way out of town, and not very near the Metro. It is about ten minutes walk from Park Guell, but only because they have put escalators in the hilly parts and steep steps on the backstreets you walk along. the other side of the hotel is a huge building site and a large roundabout for a ring road, which you have to negotiate to get to the main road into town. Not many restaurants nearby, we went to a Hamburger joint, but most places a bit seedy until you get into the city itself. We were quite impressed with the three bedded room with nice bathroom, spacious for two parents and a fifteen year old. However, when my daughter got up in the night, she trapped a small cockroach in a tooth glass, which she proudly showed us the next day. They charge a deposit for the remote control, on the owner's orders, the staff seem quite embarrassed about this. Staff very friendly, and a nice little breakfast buffet at a reasonable price. However, we spent what we saved on taxis while we were there, so I would recommend a more central hotel unless you have business in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price but not really a 3-star”
Reviews.Author: R0zy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is VERY good value for your money since it is on average around 60 Euros a night. We weren't able to find any other comparable hotels in a decent location at that price. Rooms are clean and very nicely furnished, big by European standards, very modern with hard wood floors, flat screen TV (with only 1-2 english channels), a couch, and speakers which you could plug your IPOD into. The decor and rooms are definitely a nice surprise. Bathrooms, however, are moderately clean. There are fingerprints, hairs, dust. There is a small jacuzzi bathtub/shower, hairdryer and some freebies (shampoo, soap, comb... although I wouldn't use the jacuzzi and the products didn't smell very good). There is a general odd smell in the bathroom and rooms... seems like it might be the cleaning products they use, although this can easily be fixed by opening the window to air out the room a bit. You have to pay a 20 Euro deposit for the remote control, and access to the safe is 4 Euros per day. Parking is 20 Euros a day. The hotel is not in a very noisy neighborhood but the walls of the hotel are very thin. Location is good, especially if you want to be able to easily access the city center without having to worry about being in a sketchy neighborhood. It is only a few minutes walk to the metro (Lesseps) on the Green Line, which is around a 10 minute ride to Placa Catalunya. When the metro stops running (around midnight), it is very convenient to get back using the N4 bus which leaves from Placa Catalunya and drops you off almost in fron tof the hotel. I would recommend getting a T-10 travelcard during your stay. The neighborhood has a few grocery stores nearby which was very convenient, some bakeries, very little cafes and restos, and an internet cafe about 5 minutes away. Parc Guell, which is beautiful and one of Barcelona's main attractions, was only about a 10-15 minute walk away which was a definite bonus. The staff is not accomodating and generally unprofessional. They were not able to get us an extra cup, pillow and towel when we arrived at night, though we had booked a triple room and the room was only furnished for 2. Getting some ice from the bar was also an issue. Breakfast is now 10 Euros and definitely not worth it... the fruit is not even fresh but out of a can. Go to a bakery or cafe instead. We ran into problems with the staff when we had one of our friends stop by the hotel and they basically would not allow any visitors. Overall, I would not rate this a 3-star hotel. It's more like a really nice hostal since there are no guest services that hotels normally offer. The staff (both cleaning and front desk) are amateurish and seem unwilling to go the extra length to accomodate you. Other 3 star hotels in Barcelona seem a lot nicer and are definitely more accomodating. But they are also a lot more expensive. Definitely excellent value for your money. Don't go in expecting too much and you will be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “A well kept insider tip!”
Reviews.Author: Vuelo
Reviews.Content: As we booked our trip to BCN only 2 weeks before, not many affordable hotels left in the city & decided to stay at the Ronda Lesseps: it was the best decision we could have taken! True, a little off from the center but with only 4 subway (line 3) stops to Plaça de Catalunya (direct bus to the airport EUR 3,75) and the station just a few minutes away from the hotel, not an issue. The reception staff was extremely friendly, the room large enough and pleasant, flat screen television, full bathroom, including a jacuzzi (yes!). The cleaning ladies did a good job, everything just spotless. The breakfast with orange drink, coffe/tea/chocolate, bread, croissants, cold cut, cheese, cereals, yoghurts and fresh fruits at EUR 6 is very generous. The pilipina lady working in the breakfast room is very friendly and fast to refill the buffet. Overall a VERY good hotel at a very reasonable price; i would not hesitate to recommend it and will certainly stay there in the future. P.S.: you have to pay for the room when you check-in and deposit EUR 20 to get the remote control of the television (which you get back when you return it)

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: lithium_mt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in Oct 05. The rooms are better than you would find in a good 4-star hotel despite it being a 3-star hotel. They have parquet (?)flooring, flat screen tv (only 1 english channel), jacuzzi bath, automatic lights. The beds are extremely comfortable and the rooms are large by european standards. There is no mini-bar in the room though. Ensure that you ask for a room which does not overlook the street because although the rooms have double-glazed windows, the noise can still be bad! There were some extension works being carried out while I was staying there and this meant that sleeping between 9am and 6pm was impossible due to the noise coming from a pneumatic hammer. The breakfast was quite basic: cereal, yoghurt, toast, fruit, ham, salami and fruit juice. The hotel is a 3 minute walk from the underground station. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and wouldn't hesitate to go back.
